Inspired by Pizza

Pac-Man was created by Japanese designer Toru Iwatani and released by Namco in Japan in 1980, quickly becoming a global phenomenon. The game, originally named "Puck-Man", was inspired by the shape of a pizza with a slice missing and the Japanese phrase for the sound of chomping.

Inspired by Pizza

Pac-Man was created by Japanese designer Toru Iwatani and released by Namco in Japan in 1980, quickly becoming a global phenomenon. The game, originally named "Puck-Man", was inspired by the shape of a pizza with a slice missing and the Japanese phrase for the sound of chomping.
